item.title: John add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "What the really great artists do is they're entirely themselves. They're entirely themselves, they've got their own vision, they have their own way of fracturing reality, and if it's authentic and true, you will feel it in your nerve endings." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: John add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "A little bad taste is like a nice dash of paprika." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: John add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Where they have burned books, they will end in burning human beings." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: John add a quote by Chris Onstad
item.description: "Welcome to the only game in town." -- Chris Onstad

item.title: John add a quote by Chris Adrian
item.description: "If there’s a magic pony in the story, chances are I’ll read it." -- Chris Adrian

item.title: John add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "Imagine a world in which generations of human beings come to believe that certain films were made by God or that specific software was coded by him. Imagine a future in which millions of our descendants murder each other over rival interpretations of Star Wars or Windows 98. Could anything -- anything -- be more ridiculous? And yet, this would be no more ridiculous than the world we are living in. " -- Sam Harris

item.title: John add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "In reality, every reader is, while reading, the reader of his own self." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: John add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Literary fiction and poetry are real marginalized right now. There's a fallacy that some of my friends sometimes fall into, the ol' "The audience is stupid. The audience only wants to go this deep. Poor us, we're marginalized because of TV, the great hypnotic blah, blah." You can sit around and have these pity parties for yourself. Of course this is bullshit. If an art form is marginalized it's because it's not speaking to people. One possible reason is that the people it's speaking to have become too stupid to appreciate it. That seems a little easy to me." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: John add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "Read, every day, something no one else is reading. Think, every day, something no one else is thinking. Do, every day, something no one else would be silly enough to do. It is bad for the mind to be always part of unanimity." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: John add a quote by Miguel de Unamuno
item.description: "Men shout to avoid listening to one another." -- Miguel de Unamuno

item.title: John add a quote by Kukai
item.description: "Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the men of old; seek what they sought." -- Kukai

item.title: John add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: John add a quote by Vilhelm Ekelund
item.description: "To read fast is as bad as to eat in a hurry." -- Vilhelm Ekelund
